intro: Anastraphia recurva, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a unique plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of its fronds, which gives it an elegant and intricate appearance. The plant produces small, delicate sporangia on the undersides of its leaves, which are responsible for reproduction through spores. Anastraphia recurva thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a popular specimen in botanical gardens and a subject of study in plant morphology.
